content:
Hi all! I've opened PR#26986, which adds a bijective lemma in the context of integer partitions.

Specifically, it shows that:

The number of partitions of n that contain r as a part and have all parts ≤ r
equals the number of partitions of n - r whose largest part is ≤ r.

The proof constructs an explicit bijection between these two sets using the existing Partition structure in Mathlib.Data.Nat.Partition. Both directions are implemented, the bijection is proven to be mutual inverses, and Fintype.card_congr is applied.

I'm wondering whether this should live in a more specialized file or if the current location is fine. Feedback on naming, structure, or proof style is very welcome — thanks!

Quick question about PR#26986
It gives a bijection between certain restricted partitions (details in the PR). I mainly wonder:

  • Is Mathlib.Combinatorics.Enumerative.Partition the right place for this lemma?
  • Does the naming/proof style look okay, or should I adjust it?
    Any feedback would be really appreciated, thanks!

Hey everyone!
I’ve updated PR#26986 with some improvements — cleaned up a few details in the proof and adjusted the naming/placement a bit.
Would love to get your thoughts on whether this version reads more smoothly now. Thanks!
